title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 03 December 2014 - XWiki
content:

11:11 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:15 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:26 <tmortagne> evalica: Hi, you have a closed issue with missing documentation left for 6.4M1  
11:27 <tmortagne> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11155  
11:27 <evalica> yes - thank you - I want to update the e.x.o page after the release - thanks for reminding me  
11:29 <tmortagne> sdumitriu: same for you when you have some time  
11:29 <tmortagne> XWIKI-11417  
11:50 <vmassol> has quit  
11:50 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:54 <vmassol> tmortagne and all: do you have an opinion on which API you find best: http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Proposal/BatchMailSenderAPI#HAPIChoices I'm still hesitating on my side between solution 1 and 2  
11:56 <tmortagne> I don't like too much solution 2 in your use case, you have to know the component implementation to give it the right parameters but at the same time the API takes anything in a vararg  
11:57 <tmortagne> but actually 1 does not really seems better on that aspect  
12:00 <tmortagne> how one knows what parameters should be passed to create or init ?  
12:16 <user> has joined #xwiki  
12:27 <Pbas> has quit  
12:31 <cjd> has quit  
12:35 <user> has quit  
12:36 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
12:36 <mouhb> has joined #xwiki  
12:37 <mouhb> has quit  
12:46 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
12:58 <AFKGeek> has joined #xwiki  
13:16 <vmassol> a good jira to fix for tomorrow's BFD: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11518 :)  
13:26 <vmassol> it seems that if a page was saved with a user having PR, even if this user is removed from the wiki then the page still has PR. I wonder how that works. Anyone knows?  
13:29 <vmassol> ah no  
13:29 <vmassol> thought it was the Admin user since it says "Created by Admin on 2013/03/28 21:23"  
13:30 <vmassol> but actually the user is xwiki:XWiki.superadmin  
13:30 <vmassol> I wonder why we display 'Admin' for superadmin  
13:30 <vmassol> that's misleading...  
13:41 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
13:58 <OSIMasson> has quit  
14:01 <vmassol> tmortagne: "how one knows what parameters should be passed to create or init ?" because they're part of the api  
14:01 <vmassol> for example: UsersMimeMessageIteratorFactory  
14:01 <vmassol> in solution 1bis you wouldn't know but in solution 1 they are typed  
14:02 <vmassol> this is why I'm leaning towards solution 1 and not 1bis  
14:02 <vmassol> :)  
14:05 <tmortagne> yep would be better to display something more explicit  
14:05 <tmortagne> talking about superadmin  
14:05 <tmortagne> and author display  
14:06 <vmassol> it used to be "superadmin" I think  
14:06 <vmassol> not sure when it was changed  
14:06 <vmassol> maybe a translation changed that...  
14:07 <vmassol> no  
14:07 <tmortagne> as for mail API 1 makes more sense to me, 1bis and 2 have the exact same issue  
14:07 <vmassol> ok so we agree, going for 1 then  
14:07 <vmassol> thanks  
14:12 <vmassol> hmm  
14:12 <vmassol> "XWiki Authenticator Headers" —> Headers Authentiactor  
14:12 <vmassol> \*Authenticator  
14:14 <tmortagne> vmassol: Denis did it that way because there is several authenticators with the same naming I think  
14:19 <Enygma`> mockito question: Is there any way I could specify that in my test I do not want to mock a component of my code (so that the actual implementation runs) but in a way that does not force me to use the real implementations of the components that my unmocked component relies on? If I use @ComponentList({DefaultMyComponent.class}), I then have to list all the implementations of DefaultMyComponent's dependencies, when, instead, I would like to mock one of those dep  
14:20 <vmassol> tmortagne: which doesn't make it right  
14:20 <vmassol> I talked to him  
14:20 <vmassol> he'll fix in 2.0.1  
14:21 <vmassol> "If I use @ComponentList({DefaultMyComponent.class}), I then have to list all the implementations of DefaultMyComponent's dependencies"  
14:21 <Enygma`> A (component under test) depends on B (other component of my module) depends on C (component of other module). In A's test I write @ComponentList({DefaultA.class, DefaultC.class}), but I would like to be able to mock C in A's test, so to not specify DefaultC.class in @ComponentList  
14:21 <tmortagne> Enygma`: the thing is that the mocker does not load the component.txt so it does not know any implementation that's why you need to give it  
14:21 <vmassol> I don't think so  
14:21 <vmassol> you have to make sure there are impl available  
14:21 <vmassol> be them the real one or mocked ones  
14:22 <vmassol> so list the real ones in @ComponentList and register mock component in the test  
14:22 <tmortagne> @ComponentList is not so much a way to indicate what to not mock but to indicate what are the available components  
14:22 <Enygma`> so mocker.registerMockComponent(...) that overrides the default one listed?  
14:22 <vmassol> make sure you really need the real ones as it's usually better to use mocks everywhere, unless you're writing some integration test  
14:23 <tmortagne> it depends when you call mocker.registerMockComponent(...)  
14:23 <vmassol> Enygma`: no, don't list them  
14:23 <Enygma`> I want the real one for B (other part of my code) but not for C (3rd party component from other module)  
14:23 <vmassol> just list the real ones  
14:23 <vmassol> and mock the others  
14:23 <Enygma`> so how do I mock C ?  
14:23 <vmassol> registerMockComponen for ex  
14:23 <Enygma`> mocker.getInstance will give me the real instance  
14:23 <Enygma`> aha  
14:23 <vmassol> it won't  
14:24 <vmassol> unless you delcare the in @ComponentList  
14:24 <Enygma`> and I can call registerMockComponent whenever?  
14:24 <vmassol> so don't declare them thtere  
14:24 <vmassol> :)  
14:24 <vmassol> @BeforeComponent for example  
14:24 <Enygma`> aha, looking into that...  
14:35 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> has joined #xwiki  
14:35 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> Bonjour  
14:36 <popcek> has joined #xwiki  
14:36 <cjd> hi  
14:36 <popcek> hello... i have a question if its possible to autenticate xwiki over ldap with tls support  
14:38 <cjd> unsure re tls, tmortagne  ?  
14:38 <tmortagne> popcek: some did AFAIK yes  
14:39 <tmortagne> it's more at general Java level than XWiki level actually  
14:39 <popcek> i try http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-865  
14:39 <vmassol> popcek: I see http://xwiki.475771.n2.nabble.com/XWiki-and-LDAP-TLS-binding-td7589243.html  
14:39 <tmortagne> you have xwiki.authentication.ldap.ssl.secure\_provider in xwiki.cfg and then you configure this provider through Java system properties  
14:40 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
14:40 <popcek> ok ... i ll try to set up java properties ...  
14:41 <tmortagne> you should find a few threads about that in the mailing list like the one mentionned by vmassol  
14:42 <popcek> so settting up xwiki.autentication.ldap.ssl.keystore in xwiki.cfg is useless?  
14:42 <tmortagne> we are missing some clean documentation in xwiki.org written by someone who actually did it  
14:42 <tmortagne> no it's not useless but it's actually possible to set it from Java properties too depending on the provider so your choice  
14:43 <tmortagne> ha and dont forget xwiki.authentication.ldap.ssl=1 too  
14:43 <tmortagne> to enable SSL  
14:46 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> Hello, I can't change the default skin logo through "edit/XWiki/DefaultSkin". The attached image is loaded, but it doesn't appear when I save the page. Can u help me please ?  
14:47 <ClemensR> xwikiorg\_guest\_1:  there is a Logo on the ColorTheme, too, in some cases  
14:48 <ClemensR> this has precedence over the DefaultSkin logo  
14:48 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> OK, I'll try and tell u if it works   ;)  
14:50 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> Yes, I've found it ! Thank you  
14:50 <ClemensR> (actually that is only true for the old non-flamingo ColorThemes, I see only now ...)  
14:52 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> I customized the color theme, and remove "logo.png" in the "Logo" field  
14:52 <ClemensR> yes, in the colibri style color themes that is the way I have fixed it, too :)  
14:53 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> Great  
15:12 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> has quit  
15:38 <vmassol> evalica: images are a bit largish :)  
15:43 <ClemensR> If I disable showing panels in the XWiki Space via the panle wizard, they are still shown in the Wiki Admin .... strange ...  
15:48 <popcek> i tried everything ... but iam still failing to suscessfuly connect with tls  
15:48 <popcek> i enabled xwiki.authentication.authclass=  
15:48 <popcek> then seted xwiki.authentication.ldap=1  
15:49 <popcek> seted xwiki.authentication.ldap.ssl.keystore=  
15:49 <popcek> seted xwiki.authentication.ldap.ssl.secure\_provider  
15:50 <popcek> added java options -Djavax.net.ssl.keyStore=\*\*\*\*\*\*\*/ldap.jks -Djavax.net.ssl.keyStorePassword=changeit  
15:50 <popcek> and imported keytool -import -alias ldap -file ldap.crt -keystore ldap.jks  
15:50 <popcek> what iam doing wrong here?  
16:00 <vmassol> evalica: shouldn't the Add and Search button be of the same size: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/FAQ+Application/faq.png?width=600 ?  
16:00 <vmassol> (it's nice otherwise :))  
16:00 <vmassol> note: there's no filter for date columns :) but you have arrows for them: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/FAQ+Application/viewfaq1.png?width=600  
16:01 <evalica> vmassol: the size of the button depends on the content. We don't have a fixed size.  
16:01 <evalica> I just replicated the old snapshots with the new design.  
16:01 <vmassol> we used to have filters but they were not working so we removed them  
16:01 <ClemensR> popcek:  I found setting -Djavax.net.debug=all  creates lots of output, but is sometimes helps to track down the problem  
16:01 <vmassol> ATM we don't have working filters for dates AFIK  
16:02 <vmassol> \*AFAIK  
16:02 <evalica> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/viewattachrev/Extension/FAQ+Application/viewfaq1.png  
16:03 <popcek> ClemensR: thank you i'll try this setting
